summary: Building SAHAAY — India’s National AI Guide: a trust-first, legally safe, multilingual, chat-first citizen guidance platform that explains Indian laws, rights, government processes, and life situations in simple language (guidance/explanations only; no professional advice or decisions).
architectural_notes: Positioning/constraint: citizen guidance system, not a chatbot clone; provides explanations and process clarity, not decisions or professional advice.
Priority pillars: legal safety, accuracy & trust, national-scale readiness, simplicity for non-technical users, India-first but global-ready.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- SAHAAY logo mark, minimal, trustworthy, India-inspired geometric icon (sahaay-logo-mark.dim_512x512.png)
- SAHAAY wordmark, clean sans-serif logotype, black/dark variant on transparent background (sahaay-wordmark.dim_1400x400.png)
- Subtle background pattern, low-contrast, abstract India-inspired motif (sahaay-bg-pattern.dim_2000x2000.png)

existing_features.title: Create the SAHAAY MVP shell with a chat-first interface for citizen guidance (web). The UI must clearly communicate that SAHAAY provides explanations and process clarity, not professional advice or decisions.

Implement multilingual support with a language selector and a language-preference state used across the UI and guidance responses. Include at least: English and Hindi (with a UI that can be extended to more Indian languages later).
Implement trust & safety features: (a) strong disclaimers, (b) source citations for each guidance response when applicable, and (c) ‘What SAHAAY can/can’t do’ panel in the UI.

Add a guided entry experience for non-technical users: provide quick-start tiles/buttons for common situations (e.g., Job loss, Salary issue, Fraud) and common intents (Understand a law/right, Understand a government process).
Create a simple conversation/session model: users can have multiple saved sessions locally and/or in the backend; each session stores messages, selected language, and chosen flow/topic context.

Define and apply one coherent visual theme for SAHAAY (India-first, trust-first, accessible). Avoid blue/purple as the primary palette. Use high-contrast typography, clear hierarchy, and mobile-first layout.
Generate and include basic static brand assets for SAHAAY (logo mark + wordmark + subtle background pattern) and render them from the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated.

new_feature_requests.summary: Multilingual, chat-first citizen guidance platform (web/app) for India; simple UX for non-technical users
Legal literacy module: explain Indian laws/rights in plain language with strong legal-safety posture (not legal advice; no decisions)
Government systems/process guidance module: explain schemes/forms/process steps (process clarity, not official submission)
Life-situation guidance flows (e.g., job loss, salary issues, fraud) that route users to relevant explanations and processes
Trust & safety features: show sources, clear disclaimers, accuracy-first positioning

Add curated knowledge modules in the backend for: (1) Laws & Rights explanations, (2) Government processes/schemes/process steps, and (3) Life-situation guided flows (e.g., job loss, salary issues, fraud). These modules should drive responses without relying on external AI/LLM services.

Add an admin-free content bootstrap: ship the MVP with a small built-in curated dataset (topics, flows, and citations) compiled into the backend so the app works end-to-end without external dependencies.
